original: @265a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @265a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: m'a r'i tsyee de b'i s'a dha nam /
analyzed: m'a r'i tsyee de b'i s'a dha nam /
translated: Marīcīdevīsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs /
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs /
translated: Goddess Marīcī’s Sādhana

original: @265b lha mo 'od zer can la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @265b lha mo 'od zer can la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the goddess Marīcī.

original: de la dang por nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
analyzed: de la dang por nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
translated: First, visualize a sun maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du sa bon lnga pa'i lnga pa la /
analyzed: de'i steng du sa bon lnga pa'i lnga pa la /
translated: On top of that, visualize the fifth of the fifth seed syllable,

original: dang po'i gnyis pa rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: dang po'i gnyis pa rdzogs par byas la /
translated: with the second of the first complete,

original: zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan par bsam /
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa dang thig les brgyan par bsam /
translated: adorned with a half-moon and a drop.

original: de las byung ba'i lha mo 'od zer can sku mdog dmar ba /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i lha mo 'od zer can sku mdog dmar ba /
translated: From that, visualize the goddess Marīcī, red in color,

original: zhal drug pa /
analyzed: zhal drug pa /
translated: with six faces,

original: zhal dang po dmar ba /
analyzed: zhal dang po dmar ba /
translated: the first face red,

original: gnyis pa nag pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa nag pa /
translated: the second black,

original: gsum pa ljang gu /
analyzed: gsum pa ljang gu /
translated: the third green,

original: bzhi pa ser ba /
analyzed: bzhi pa ser ba /
translated: the fourth yellow,

original: lnga pa dkar ba /
analyzed: lnga pa dkar ba /
translated: the fifth white,

original: steng gi dbu phag gdong nag po /
analyzed: steng gi dbu phag gdong nag po /
translated: and the upper face a black pig’s face.

original: aa shva ka dang / mchod rten gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: aa shva ka dang / mchod rten gyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with aśoka trees and stūpas,

original: gsus khyim che ba /
analyzed: gsus khyim che ba /
translated: with a large potbelly,

original: thod pa'i phreng ba can /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba can /
translated: a garland of skulls,

original: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: and upward-streaming orange hair.

original: sbrul gyi zhags pa dang stag lpags kyi sham thabs can /
analyzed: sbrul gyi zhags pa dang stag lpags kyi sham thabs can /
translated: She has a snake noose and a tiger-skin skirt.

original: bgegs rnams ltung bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: bgegs rnams ltung bar mdzad pa /
translated: He causes obstacles to fall.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i shing rta la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i shing rta la g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa /
translated: He stands with his left leg straight on a chariot of various colors.

original: phyag g-yas pa na ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / gtun shing dang / mda' dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / dgra sta bsdams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa na ral gri dang / rdo rje dang / gtun shing dang / mda' dang rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / dgra sta bsdams pa /
translated: In his right hands he holds a sword, a vajra, a pestle, an arrow, a single-pronged vajra, and a battle-ax.

original: g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang bcas pa dang / thod pa dang aa shva ka'i yal ga dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / gzhu dang / tri sh'u la bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang bcas pa dang / thod pa dang aa shva ka'i yal ga dang / tshangs pa'i mgo bo dang / gzhu dang / tri sh'u la bsnams pa'o //
translated: In his left hands he holds a threatening gesture with a noose, a skull cup, an aśoka branch, a head of Brahmā, a bow, and a trident.

original: spyan gsum par bsam zhing /
analyzed: spyan gsum par bsam zhing /
translated: He is imagined to have three eyes.

original: mdun du shing zlum po'i dbus su lag pa gnyis sdigs mdzub bsgreng bar bsams la /
analyzed: mdun du shing zlum po'i dbus su lag pa gnyis sdigs mdzub bsgreng bar bsams la /
translated: In front of him, in the middle of a round tree, one should imagine the two hands raised in a threatening gesture.

original: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma yum 'od zer can yin no zhes pa'i nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ma yum 'od zer can yin no zhes pa'i nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate the pride that thinks, “I am the Blessed Lady Mārīcī.”

original: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should bind the mudrā.

original: rdo rje thal mo kha sbyar la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo kha sbyar la /
translated: One should join the vajra palms together.

original: gung mo gnyis gshibs la myu gur byas te /
analyzed: gung mo gnyis gshibs la myu gur byas te /
translated: One should straighten the two middle fingers and make them into sprouts.

original: mthe bong gnyis skyil mo krung du bsnol mdzub mo gnyis rtse mor dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: mthe bong gnyis skyil mo krung du bsnol mdzub mo gnyis rtse mor dgug par bya'o //
translated: The two thumbs are crossed in a bind, and the two index fingers are bent at the tips.

original: de nas bzlas pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa'i sngags ni /
translated: Then the mantra for the recitation is:

original: aom m'a r'i tsyee m'am h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom m'a r'i tsyee m'am h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ māri cye māri cye hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: lha mo 'od zer can gyi sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
translated: The sādhana of the goddess Marīcī is complete.
